entry.content: Hello Florence, don't you have somewhere else to go?

entry.title: Slight Delay
entry.summary:
So I haven't been here in a while and I clearly missed the mark with one of my goals. The goal I have missed is getting organized.

So initially I put the github pages up easy peasy. However I didn't document how I did it. I didn't even save links …
entry.content:
So I haven't been here in a while and I clearly missed the mark with one of my goals. The goal I have missed is getting organized.

So initially I put the github pages up easy peasy. However I didn't document how I did it. I didn't even save links for the websites that helped me a long. I didn't save the password for the VM that I created to host my github work space. I didn't .. I didn't ... I didn't. So while what I did wasn't difficult figuring out how I went about it was gone. Start over.

So here we are. I saved links and will document soon. One thing learned by starting over is that I am getting a better understanding of what I did earlier. I didn't even understand that earlier my website content, the output from pelican was in a different part of the repository than the input to pelican. The input to pelican was on the source branch and the content was in master. I had not pushed the source branch back to github. Master was pushed as part of publishing the website. Fortunately there isn't much here, so the lost password and VM wasn't a big deal. Maximum Null.

entry.title: It is a start
entry.summary:
Hello and welcome to my github hosted static website. There isn't much going on right now and since I have a family and a full time job I am not expecting this ever to be non stop action. Hopefully every now and then I do get back here.

I do …
entry.content:
Hello and welcome to my github hosted static website. There isn't much going on right now and since I have a family and a full time job I am not expecting this ever to be non stop action. Hopefully every now and then I do get back here.

I do have some general goals. I am not exactly sure if github can help me with those goals.

One thing I would like to do is get organized. The value of organization isn't as much as it used to be. Google can find everything for you. However I have not yet been able to get google to find anything I have forgotten. Perhaps this could be a place where I put things as a reminder. Like a note that you take to the grocery store that says "bread, milk, eggs"...the same note week after week.

The other thing I would like to do is learn. It would be good to have a little direction in that learning. Organization would help with direction. Look! I am learning a little about github pages and Pelican!
